author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Canada Border Services Agency (CBSA) says it has resolved another system outage that affected its inspection kiosks at airports across Canada on Oct. 2, but travellers may continue to face delays. “The outage has been resolved,” the CBSA said in an Oct. 2 X post around 1:50 p.m. “Travellers may continue to experience delays […]
title: CBSA Resolves Another Outage Affecting Inspection Kiosks at Canadian Airports

author: Chandra Philip
description: Albertans lead the country when it comes to moving up on the social and economic ladder, while Quebec ranks at the bottom of the list for “social mobility,” according to results of a new study. The study Barriers to Social Mobility Across Canada, from the public policy think tank MEI, looked at metrics like occupational […]
title: Alberta Leads the Country for ‘Social Mobility’ Opportunities, Quebec at Bottom of List: Study

author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Attack at the Synagogue, Oktoberfest Reopens After Bomb Threat, and Military Exercises in Estonia

author: The Canadian Press
description: A new report from a federal security task force says foreign interference activities during the last general election were “small scale” and often difficult to attribute to an actor from abroad. The Security and Intelligence Threats to Elections Task Force includes representatives of Global Affairs Canada, the Canadian Security Intelligence Service, the RCMP and the […]
title: Security Task Force Says It Saw ‘Small Scale’ Foreign Meddling During Federal Vote

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Parliamentary Budget Officer (PBO) says it will be challenging for Ottawa to combine spending cuts with increased investment as the prime minister has promised. Interim PBO Jason Jacques told the Senate committee on national finance that he couldn’t remember a time when the prime minister has said Canada needs to engage in both “austerity” […]
title: Ottawa Pressing Gas and Brakes at Same Time in Fiscal Policy, Budget Watchdog Says

author: Chandra Philip
description: RCMP in Alberta have charged two suspects and are searching for a third after a century-old church was burned down in a community northeast of Edmonton. Smoky Lake RCMP said officers were responding to reports of vehicle thefts in the community on Sept. 21, when they received reports of a fire in the nearby hamlet […]
title: RCMP Lay Charges in Alberta Ukrainian Orthodox Church Burning

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: B.C. Premier David Eby says Alberta’s proposed new pipeline to B.C.’s north coast is “not a real project” as it has no private backing, saying he wants to focus on shovel-ready projects benefiting his province. Alberta Premier Danielle Smith announced on Oct. 1 her government’s plan to commit $14 million to developing and submitting an […]
title: BC Premier Eby Says Alberta’s Pipeline Pitch to Major Projects Office ‘Not a Real Project’

author: PA Media
description: The boss of Tesco has made a plea to the Government to not “make it harder” for the grocery sector to keep prices low for customers ahead of the autumn Budget, despite revealing profits could surpass £3 billion this year. Households budgets remain squeezed and shoppers are increasingly seeking out value, according to the UK’s […]
title: Do Not Make It Harder for Grocers to Lower Prices, Tesco Boss Urges Government

author: The Canadian Press
description: Liberal member of Parliament Marie-France Lalonde wants to end what she calls the “outdated practice” of daylight time. The Ottawa-area MP plans to table a private member’s bill next week to call a halt to the annual ritual of springing forward and falling back. The bill will ask the federal government to first hold a […]
title: Liberal MP to Introduce Bill to Abolish Daylight Time

author: The Canadian Press
description: Just over a year after they opened, Loblaw Cos. Ltd. is closing a second location of the three No Name stores it was piloting as a bet on ultra-discount. The grocer says it will close its LaSalle, Ont., No Name store near Windsor on Oct. 25, after already shuttering its St. Catharines store in July. […]
title: Loblaw Closing Second of Three Ultra-Discount No Name Stores

author: Tom Ozimek
description: Moscow also warned of escalation as the Trump administration weighs providing Ukraine with long-range Tomahawk missiles.
title: Kremlin Says US Aiding Ukraine for Strikes Deep Inside Russia

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Montreal Port Authority says it intends to begin preparatory work this fall on its planned expansion in the nearby town of Contrecœur, Que. The project still requires authorization from Fisheries and Oceans Canada because it would be built in the habitat of the endangered copper redhorse fish. Prime Minister Mark Carney included the port […]
title: Preparatory Work to Begin This Fall for Expansion of Port of Montreal at Contrecœur

author: The Canadian Press
description: Israel’s envoy to Canada says dialogue between his government and Ottawa has “deteriorated” since Prime Minister Mark Carney took office—and suggests his “hard line” on Gaza explains why Carney still hasn’t spoken by phone with Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu. “Since the government of Carney came into place, the level of dialogue between the two […]
title: Israeli Envoy Says Communications With Ottawa Have ‘Deteriorated’ Under Carney

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Ottawa has launched a new agency aiming to speed up defence purchases for the Canadian Armed Forces and the Canadian Coast Guard. The new Defence Investment Agency seeks to streamline the procurement process by eliminating redundancy and red tape, while expediting defence purchases through a centralized review and approval system, according to the Prime Minister’s […]
title: Ottawa Launches Procurement Agency to Fast‑Track Defence Purchases

author: Matthew Horwood
description: The Conservative Party plans to introduce a motion in the House of Commons calling for the swift passage of legislation that it says would make it more difficult for violent and repeat offenders to receive bail. Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre said current federal bail laws have led to ongoing cases of repeat offenders victimizing Canadians, […]
title: Tories to Introduce Motion Calling for Quick Passage of ‘Jail Not Bail’ Bill

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Via Rail has halted a pilot initiative to provide direct service between Montreal and Toronto because of “operational constraints” with CN, the rail service says. Via Rail was gearing up to launch a three-month nonstop service test on Sept. 29 on four trains travelling between the two cities. The purpose of the pilot project was […]
title: Via Rail Puts Nonstop Montreal-Toronto Rail Pilot Project on Hold

author: Chandra Philip
description: Faytene Grasseschi, a longtime broadcaster and Christian activist, didn’t know that when she decided to run in the 2024 New Brunswick election it would end with her fleeing to the other side of the country out of concern for the safety of her family. “The toxicity escalated to the point where it was no longer […]
title: ‘Restore Safety and Civility’: Why This NB Political Candidate Fled Across the Country for Safety

author: Olivia Gomm
description: The Liberal government’s new hate crime bill has made a step forward in the House of Commons, while opposition parties are expressing concerns about some of its content. Bill C-9, also known as the Combatting Hate Act, was introduced by Justice Minister Sean Fraser on Sept. 19. It aims to add four new hate-related offences […]
title: New Hate Crime Bill Advances in Commons as Opposition MPs Voice Concerns

author: Epoch Video
description: Scotland Yard reads a statement and Manchester police hold a press conference following an attack at a synagogue in Manchester, UK, on Oct. 2. Schedule: 10:20 a.m. ET LOCATION: LONDON (SCOTLAND YARD STATEMENT) 10:24 a.m. ET LOCATION: MANCHESTER (MANCHESTER POLICE STATEMENT/PRESSER) 10:46 a.m. ET STREET VIEW IN MANCHESTER, POLICE AND EMERGENCY SERVICES CLOSE TO WHERE […]
title: LIVE NOW: Scotland Yard and Manchester Police Hold Press Conference After Synagogue Attack

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The CEO of Canada Post says he supports the government’s plans to bolster the Crown corporation’s finances and hinted that major workforce reductions could be on the horizon. Doug Ettinger’s remarks were delivered this week via an open letter as a national strike by postal workers continues. The strike is a reaction to the sweeping […]
title: Canada Post CEO Says He Supports Ottawa’s Measures to Strengthen Finances

author: The Canadian Press
description: Senior federal officials touted a proposed liquefied natural gas facility in Quebec as having the potential to export “substantial volumes” of LNG to Europe, documents show. The revelation appears in a federal briefing note prepared in May after Marinvest Energy Canada, a subsidiary of a Norwegian energy company, requested a meeting with the top bureaucrat […]
title: Federal Officials Were Interested in Proposed Quebec LNG Project, Documents Show

author: Guy Birchall
description: The plan comes amid rising concerns about the levels of immigration in the UK and across Europe.
title: UK to Toughen Rules on Refugees Seeking Permanent Residency

author: Chris Summers
description: French President Emmanuel Macron said the crew had committed 'very serious wrongdoings' after the ship was linked to drone incursions over Denmark.
title: Captain of Russian Shadow Fleet Ship Detained off Coast of France

author: Epoch Video
description: British police and emergency services on Oct. 2 at the scene near a synagogue near Manchester, where police said four people had been injured after a car was driven at pedestrians and one person was stabbed.
title: Police Cordon Near Manchester Synagogue Where 4 Are Injured in Suspected Attack

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The convoy left Greece in September with European lawmakers, activists and aid workers on board.
title: Israel Says Gaza Flotilla Passengers Escorted to Israel Face Deportation

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The attack took place on Yom Kippur, the holiest day in the Jewish calendar, when worshippers traditionally spend the day fasting and in prayer.
title: 2 Killed in Attack on UK Synagogue, Suspect Shot by Police

author: Alex Wu
description: The extreme control measures are not necessary and spark suspicion that other diseases are spreading at the same time, according to experts.
title: As Authorities Battle Chikungunya Virus in Southern China, Mosquito-Control Measures Spark Concerns

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The Allan Labor government received 36,770 responses to its statewide consultation—the largest workplace survey in the state’s history.
title: Government Survey Shows Overwhelming Support for Work From Home Legislation

author: Monica O’Shea
description: In coming months, new laws will also come into force giving the government the power to shut down shops selling illegal vapes or illicit tobacco
title: Fines of up to $44K for NSW Retailers Selling Tobacco Without a Licence

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: Despite a loss of $2.76 million, The Warehouse Group says the outlook is positive, with things having improved in the second half of the year.
title: New Zealand’s Biggest Retailer Records Another Year of Losses

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The countries failed to meet the standards of the US Trafficking Victims Protection Act.
title: New Zealand and Pacific Nations Failing to Stop Trafficking, US State Department Says

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: The long awaited Pukpuk treaty is now a step closer to being finalised in diplomatic win for Australia against the CCP's influence in the region.
title: PNG Cabinet Backs New Defence Pact, Elevating Ties With Australia to Full Ally Status

author: The Associated Press
description: MUNICH—German police closed the Oktoberfest fairgrounds Wednesday morning following a bomb threat from the suspected perpetrator of an explosion in northern Munich, city officials said. At least one person’s death was believed to be connected to the explosion at a residential building early Wednesday, which Munich police said was deliberately set on fire and part […]
title: Munich Oktoberfest Fairgrounds Closed After Bomb Threat and Deadly Explosion

author: PA Media
description: A company linked to Tory peer Michelle Mone has been ordered to repay almost £122 million to the Government for breaching a contract to supply surgical gowns during the Covid-19 pandemic. The Department of Health and Social Care (DHSC) sued PPE Medpro at the High Court over allegations that it breached a deal for the […]
title: Company Linked to Mone Must Repay Almost £122M Over Covid PPE Contract Breach

author: PA Media
description: David Lammy has been sworn in as Lord Chancellor and Secretary of State for Justice, becoming the first black person to hold the role. The Deputy Prime Minister, who was previously foreign secretary, replaced Shabana Mahmood as justice secretary, and was sworn in before the top judges in England and Wales, including Lady Chief Justice […]
title: David Lammy ‘Humbled’ to Be Sworn in as Lord Chancellor

author: PA Media
description: Nigel Farage has had his taxpayer-funded security detail slashed by three-quarters, Reform UK has claimed. The party’s head of policy, Zia Yusuf, said parliamentary authorities had reduced Reform leader Mr Farage’s security protection “for inexplicable reasons”. It comes as Reform has accused Sir Keir Starmer’s Labour of putting the safety of Reform’s politicians and activists […]
title: Nigel Farage’s Security Cut by Parliamentary Authorities, Reform Claims

author: PA Media
description: The Southport attacker contacted two archery retailers when he was 15 asking if they could deliver crossbows in “discreet” packaging, the public inquiry into the attack has heard. Axel Rudakubana, who killed Bebe King, six, Elsie Dot Stancombe, seven, and Alice da Silva Aguiar, nine, at the Taylor Swift-themed dance class on July 29 last […]
title: Southport Attacker Contacted Retailers About Ordering Crossbows, Inquiry Told

author: PA Media
description: Activity in the UK manufacturing sector contracted at its fastest pace for five months in September after orders dropped, according to new figures. The downturn came as firms linked to the car industry also warned that their supply chains were affected by production shutdowns at Jaguar Land Rover. The S&P Global UK manufacturing PMI survey, […]
title: UK Manufacturing Activity Shrinks at Fastest Pace for 5 Months

author: PA Media
description: TV and radio star Myleene Klass has told a jury how she felt “sheer terror” after being sent a gun, handcuffs, a silver ring and a police uniform in the post by an alleged stalker. Giving evidence against Peter Windsor at Birmingham Crown Court, Ms Klass said she was informed in an email in August […]
title: Myleene Klass Tells Jury of ‘Sheer Terror’ at Parcels Posted by Alleged Stalker

author: PA Media
description: The UK is due to be hit by gale-force winds of up to 80mph as the first named storm of the season approaches. The Met Office has issued a number of weather warnings ahead of Storm Amy, which is expected to bring “very strong winds and heavy rain” to northern and western areas. Yellow weather […]
title: UK to Be Battered by 80Mph Winds as First Named Storm of Season Approaches

author: PA Media
description: A military funeral has been held for the first female officer in the Army’s most senior regiment, who was killed in a car crash. Captain Elizabeth Godwin, 28, the first female officer of the Life Guards—which is part of the Household Cavalry, died in Surrey on September 5. The funeral took place on Wednesday at […]
title: Military Funeral Held for First Female Officer in Army’s Most Senior Regiment

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The memorial will be designed in close consultation with survivors and the families of those who lost their lives.
title: Australia to Build Permanent Memorial for Bali Bombings on 20th Anniversary

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: Ministers say Canberra’s revised offer would slash its hospital share to just 35 percent, leaving states billions short.
title: States Clash With Canberra Over Hospital Funding Shortfall

author: Reuters
description: Scientist and global activist Jane Goodall, who turned her childhood love of primates into a lifelong quest for protecting the environment, has died at the age of 91, the institute she founded said on Wednesday. Goodall died of natural causes while in California on a speaking tour, the Jane Goodall Institute said in a social […]
title: Wildlife Advocate and Primate Expert Jane Goodall Dies at 91

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: A Saskatoon teenager has been sentenced to 18 months in supervised custody for the fatal shooting of his 12-year-old friend. In her Oct. 1 decision, Judge Lisa Watson ruled that the youth, who was 13 at the time, accidentally shot his friend while posing with a sawed-off rifle and pretending to be a gangster, mistakenly […]
title: Saskatoon Teen Sentenced to 18 Months for Shooting Death of 12-Year-Old Friend

author: Cindy Li
description: Yang has drawn widespread speculation about her identity, with Canada-based journalist Sheng Xue suggesting that she may be Xi Jinping’s illegitimate daughter.
title: Extra Plea Time Granted for Mysterious Wealthy Chinese Girl Involved in Rolls-Royce Crash

author: Cindy Li
description: Walk beneath the Sistine Chapel ceiling without flying to Europe.
title: Meet the Visionary Bringing the Sistine Chapel to Your Doorstep

author: PA Media
description: Researchers are investigating whether a rare British butterfly could be reared from eggs frozen in liquid nitrogen in an effort to safeguard the future of the species. The survival of the British Swallowtail butterfly, found exclusively in East Anglia and predominantly in the Norfolk Broads, is under threat and its population has dropped by 57% […]
title: Researchers Use Cryopreservation to Help Survival of Rare British Butterfly

author: Monica O’Shea
description: 'We just had the prime minister admit this morning Labor's housing policy is going to make housing policy more expensive,' Dave Sharma said.
title: Policy Making Housing More Expensive Not a Good Idea: Liberals Criticise 5 Percent Deposit Scheme

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Canada is advising citizens that those holding a Canadian passport with an “X” gender identifier may face issues crossing into the United States. Global Affairs Canada (GAC) recently added the note to its travel advisory page for travel to the United States, noting that various countries either do not recognize an “X” gender identifier as […]
title: Ottawa Cautions That Canadians With Gender-Neutral Passports May Face Issues Entering US

author: Carolina Avendano
description: An Ontario man has been sentenced to life in prison for the attempted murder of a 5-year-old child, in what the province’s Superior Court of Justice described as a “merciless” act of revenge against his former girlfriend seven years ago. Dyon Smart, 35, who was found guilty in 2022 of attempted murder, aggravated assault, and […]
title: Ontario Man Sentenced to Life in Prison for ‘Merciless’ Attack on 5-Year-Old in Revenge Against Ex-girlfriend
